title: subheader font for an architect logo?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015124601im_/http:/typophile.com/files/airoomlogosubheader500_4489.jpg)

any ideas? the top of the A is a little unusual...
author: airoomAD

comments.content:
actually - this may give you a more accurate picture. it's not the bold version.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015124601im_/http:/typophile.com/files/airoomlogosubheader500_02_6649.jpg)

I think this might be [Adobe Caslon Bold Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015124601/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adobe-caslon/) with added stroke. It tends to blunt the serifs and make it look 'slabby', but the shapes seem about right to me.

- Mike Yanega
i think you may be right mike - thanks!
